programme.title: Kickboxing Talents 19
programme.desc: The undercard for Enfusion Live, where the most promising young fighters collide.

programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 1
programme.desc: The fighters arrive at the Superpro Samui Hotel at Koh Samui Thailand. The 4 female team captains have a contest with real guns and real bullets at a shooting range. Afterwards the 4 ladies choose their own team. Cyrus feels like hell because he didnt make the weight, and in the first fight of Enfusion. Frank from Peru beats Cyrus from the USA. And the Ice Bar is where the 4 team captains have to stay in as long as possible.

programme.title: M-1 Challenge #73
programme.desc: M-1 Challenge is an MMA competition organized with a series of events held in many places around the world. The shows feature the best local and international fighters with spectacular Kos and submissions.

programme.title: A Thief on Titanic
programme.desc: It’s always been a mystery why so many passengers on board Titanic were traveling incognito. Senan Molony uncovers the identity of one secret traveler, who ended up being a thief.

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero!

programme.title: Trapped in a Tunnel
programme.desc: Senan Molony digs into the Titanic archives and finds a remarkable story of a greaser - trapped and then rescued from one of the most obscure and forgotten parts of the ship.

programme.title: What did Marine Superintendent James McGiffin Know?
programme.desc: Why was White Star’s Marine Superintendent at Queenstown never called to give evidence to the British inquiry? After all, he was one of the last White Star representatives to step off Titanic before she sailed. Is this evidence that the inquiry was...

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: Titanic's Three Bladed Propeller
programme.desc: Based on a famous 1911 photograph of Olympic in dry dock, it has always been assumed that Titanic had an identical four-bladed center propeller. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside has uncovered a Harland & Wolff document that describes a three-bladed...

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Another View on the Coal Burning Fire
programme.desc: A recent documentary presented new theories about the coal burning fire onboard Titanic. Parks Stephenson gives his view of the fire and how it affected Titanic. Senan Molony and Parks Stephenson, two of our hosts, are on Titanic’s center stage!

programme.title: The Big Four
programme.desc: Celtic, Cedric, Baltic, and Adriatic proceeded the design of Olympic, Titanic, and Britannic. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals why in many ways, they were perhaps the most successful quartet of ships ever built for North Atlantic service.

programme.title: Titanic's First-Class Lounge
programme.desc: What did you do in Titanic’s First Class Lounge? Well oddly enough you didn’t lounge, corsets and celluloid collars prevented that! Bill Sauder gives us a look at what went on inside Titanic’s magnificent lounge for the rich and famous.

programme.title: Titanic's Most Refined Features
programme.desc: Titanic Historian Bill Sauder continues his look at Titanic’s remarkable First Class Lounge. In this episode, Sauder reveals the architectural and decorative point of view and shows why the room was a showcase onboard the ship.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Inquiries and More
programme.desc: In part two of his series on lost documents, Charles Haas looks at other significant collections of Titanic documents that have simply disappeared in one way or another over the years.

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: The Last Remaining Lifeboat
programme.desc: John White, from White Star Memories, takes us through the preservation of Nomadic’s last lifeboat. From her discovery in France to her Belfast restoration, White Star’s last remaining lifeboat carries on the legacy.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Titanic’s Sunday Night Hymn Sing
programme.desc: The last formal social event on Titanic was the Sunday night hymn sing held in the second class dining saloon. Titanic Channel Host Robert Bracken provides us with new details about how this evening was destined to affect so many lives.

programme.title: The Hazards of First-Class Travel
programme.desc: Traveling first-class on Titanic was certainly luxurious. Most of the passengers were very pleasant and the food was good, but you had to be careful about letting your guard down. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder reveals the very real dangers of...

programme.title: Cape Epic 2023 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the world’s premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year, leading aspiring amateur and professional mountain bikers from around the world through 658 Untamed kilometres of unspoilt scenery and up 15775m of climbing. The Absa Cape Epic is classed as UCI Mountain Bike Marathon Series (SSR) by the Union Cycliste Internationale (UCI); this official UCI status makes it a highlight on the professional racers calendar. The Absa Cape Epic also attracts aspiring amateur riders wanting to test themselves against the best.

programme.title: Swiss Epic 2022
programme.desc: The Spar Swiss Epic is one of the Mountain Bike Epic Series’ flagship Legend events. With a fresh new route each year, it’s a unique test of endurance, resolve and skill with the staggering beauty of the snow-capped, jagged skyline set as the perfect antidote to the physical and mental demands of off-road racing. Two-person teams, top professionals and ambitious amateurs alike, explore the seemingly endless, magical trails, staying overnight in double rooms in Arosa, Laax and Davos – an unforgettable Alpine experience!

programme.title: Tour de France Saitama Criterium (Media Day)
programme.desc: The Tour de France Saitama Criterium Japan race weekend includes races for both professionals and amateurs. The two-day programme culminates with the criterium race featuring 28 top international riders (Marc Cavendish, Tadej Pogacar, Peter Sagan ...) from 7 of the worlds best professional cycling teams (UAE Emirates, Cofidis, Bahrain Victorious ...). The Media Day is about pure fun with some top international riders.

programme.title: Cro Race 2023 Stage 4
programme.desc: Cro Race 2023 Stage 4 : KRK - LABIN

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 1 - Caroline Gleich
programme.desc: Caroline Gleich, a world class ski mountaineer, summited Mt. Everest last spring as part of her #ClimbForEquality campaign to raise awareness for gender equality. In Episode 1, Gleich overcomes her own struggle after tearing her ACL to rise to the top for all women. (English version with French, Italian, German and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: Vendée Globe 2024 - Mag #12 (Eng)
programme.desc: We relive the arrival of Sébastien Simon who achieved the feat of finishing 3rd in the Vendée Globe without a starboard foil and after numerous damages. The other competitors experience different situations, go through many difficulties and make different choices of routes. This weeks expert is Hubert Lemonnier, the race director. We end this episode with Charlie Dalins media marathon.

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2024 - Cauipe, Brazil
programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour 2024 is set to host the second stop of the Freestyle discipline in Cauipe, north-eastern Brazil. The Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup showcases intense competition in the flat waters and strong winds of the lagoon, known for its stadium-like setting and vibrant atmosphere.

programme.title: Kite Masters 2023 Episode 3
programme.desc: In this episode, the WingFoil Racing World Cup takes this enthralling sport to the global stage, reaching every corner of the world. The picturesque valley of Engadin in Switzerland is no exception to this. Over the years, Engadin has captivated water sports enthusiasts, offering an ideal setting to indulge in a diverse range of disciplines and exhilarating races. At the heart of this excitement lies Lake Silvaplana, the focal point for these thrilling activities. In the present year, the ENSIS EngadinWing by Dakine took center stage, setting the perfect arena for a Wingfoil Racing World Cup stop.

programme.title: GKA Kite World Tour 2023 - Dakhla
programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour Kite-Surf riders line-up at one of the kitesurfing world’s most contestable wave riding venues at West Point in Morocco – a host country that has been an ever-present on the world tour calendar for over 15 years.

programme.title: Vanora ENGADINWIND 2024
programme.desc: The Vanora ENGADINWIND 2024 gathers once again the world class of Windsurfer and Wingfoiler competing at the Lake Silvaplana in the Engadine, Switzerland. The event has developed into the worlds most important and largest foil event. Furthermore, it is the place to be for the U23 World Championships in the iQ FOiL windsurfing category. Also, 150 windsurfers, kite-surfers and wingfoilers from 35 different nations honor tradition and take part in the 47th edition of the Engadin Surf & Kite marathon on Lake Silvaplana.Le Vanora ENGADINWIND 2024 rassemble une fois de plus la classe mondiale des Windsurfer et Wingfoiler concourant au lac Silvaplana en Engadine, en Suisse.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle-Kite World Cup Finals Qatar 2023
programme.desc: The fifth and final call at the Visit Qatar GKA Freestyle-Kite World Cup Finals Qatar plays out at the purpose-built Fuwairit Kite Beach resort’s lagoon, where the men’s and women’s champions are crowned.

programme.title: Kite Masters 2024 Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode we will travel to Austria. Once again, Lake Traunsee in Upper Austria set a magnificent backdrop for action – the 2024 KiteFoil World Series Austria took place almost a month after the conclusion of the Olympic Games and attracted riders that were eager to challenge themselves in such a unique venue.

programme.title: Visit Qatar GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2023
programme.desc: The first event of the new season is held at the Fuwairit Kite Beach Resort in Qatar opening the series with the Visit Qatar GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup.2023 Freestyle-Kite competition format:Among some smaller technical adaptations to trick family structures that aim to increase competitive excitement, essentially the Freestyle-Kite competition format will still see the four highest scoring tricks counting to a rider’s heat score from a total allowance of seven trick attempts.For 2023 Freestyle-kite fleets sizes remain the same as in the year before; limited to 28 or 14 competitors (men usually have 28 and women usually have 14). The fleet numbers for each event are realised as follows:28 riders: Top 22 ranked riders from previous season plus 6 different wildcards.14 riders: Top 11 ranked riders from previous season plus 3 different wildcards.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cléac'h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip
programme.desc: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip

programme.title: ÖTILLÖ Swimrun Cannes 2022 Official Film
programme.desc: The course of this race is a true ÖTILLÖ Swimrun World Series course with islands to cross and lots of fantastic nature. It is challenging and fun with two big hills, single track trails, amazing views and beautiful water to swim in. For those who are for the first time racing in Cannes, they are up for a surprise. To finish on the beach in front of Hotel Martinez is a treat.

programme.title: Engadinwind 2023
programme.desc: The Vanora ENGADINWIND by Dakine 2023 gathers the world class of Windsurfer and Wingfoiler competing at the Lake Silvaplana in the Engadine, Switzerland. The event has developed into the worlds most important and largest foil event. Furthermore, it is the place to be for the U21 World Championships in the iQ FOiL windsurfing category, that will be part of the Olympic programme in Paris 2024. Also, 65 windsurfers, kite-surfers and wingfoilers will honor tradition and take part in the 46th edition of the Engadin Surf & Kite marathon on Lake Silvaplana.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Worldwide premier of the Pearl 72, discover this incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Sanlorenzo SP110 - FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: Displayed at the Fort Lauderdale’s Boat Show was the Sanlorenzo SP110. This model belongs to a new series that embodies the concept of lightness and also a new approach to design.

programme.title: Tankoa Solo - A nautical masterpiece
programme.desc: The Boat Show offers you a special seat to discover magnificent vessels, inside and out. That’s the turn of the Tankoa Solo, a superyacht with a long story and was built with the only goal to be perfect in every way. Discover all the work behind this Italian masterpiece.

programme.title: Harris Sunliner 250 Sport - PBIBS 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the Harris Sunliner 250 Sport, seen at the Palm Beach Boat Show 2023.

programme.title: Mangusta Oceano 50 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Ft. Lauderdale on board the Mangusta Oceano 50, built with the idea of a big beach club and great design.

programme.title: Cobia 350 CC – Annapolis Boat Show 2022
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Annapolis Boat Show to discover all about the new Center Console motorboat Cobia 350 CC. Come join us!

programme.title: Salpa Soleil 24.5 – Adrenaline Rush
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono tries the new Salpa Soleil 24.5, proving the boat’s excellency in navigation and performance yet still maintaining comfort.

programme.title: Crownline 280 XSS - Annapolis 2022
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Annapolis Boat Show, on board the Crownline 280 XS. Discover all about this family boat.

programme.title: Nimbus T8 – Compact, powerful, fun
programme.desc: Nimbus T8 is a sporty and versatile tender, designed for comfort and handling. It is equipped with Simrad NSX by Navico Group, a cutting-edge navigation system for an intuitive and safe driving experience.

programme.title: VanDutch 32 - A powerful minimalism
programme.desc: The new VanDutch 32 is a cruiser with an extraordinary and unmistakable profile. The lines that characterize the products of VanDutch Yachts are essential and harmonious. Jump on board with The Boat Show!

programme.title: Deep Impact 499 Sport – Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is aboard the incredible Deep Impact 499 Sport center console. This boat immediately attracts attention and is equipped with 5 powerful Yamaha Mercury 500 Racing engines.

programme.title: SuperRib 30 Cabin - Maximum hold
programme.desc: Discover the SuperRib 30 Cabin, a Croatian inflatable rib characterised by a very deep V at the bow. This model sails well even on shallow water and when the sea is rough. Safety and sea keeping are never a concern.

programme.title: SuperRib 30 - Building a High Performance Rib
programme.desc: Maurizio Bulleri interviews Andelko Lemo, Project Manager of SuperRIB, to answer the question at hand: how is the premium rigid inflatable boat, SuperRib 30 open, built to the highest perfection?

programme.title: Jeanneau DB 43 - A dream day boat
programme.desc: Hop on board the Jeanneau DB 43, an ideal day-boat for those looking for an approach to boating and also a day-boat. Discover a product that goes beyond conceptual serial production.

programme.title: Cranchi A46 - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: “A is for attitude” calls for the Cranchi A46 innovations, as we step abroad together with Bill Hacket in dissecting this boat’s greatness.

programme.title: HCB 65 Estrella – MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Explore the world largest center console, the HCB 65 Estrella. Hop on board with The Boat Show!

programme.title: Axopar 37 Cross Cabin - Beast in the water
programme.desc: The Axopar 37 Cross Cabin is one of the most versatile boats you are ever gonna see and also an absolute beast in the water, come check it out!

programme.title: To be one with the sea
programme.desc: Discover an incredibly enjoyable walkaround, the Fiart 35 Seawalker. Designed by the shipyard’s technical department, led by Massimo Simioni, this warcraft has been conceived to enjoy the pleasing sensation of being one with the sea.

programme.title: Scanner Envy 1200 – Fulfilled dreams
programme.desc: The shipyard Scanner Marine has fulfilled the dream of those asking for a model such as this Scanner Envy 1200, and our Bacci Del Buono is in Varazze to test it out! Born from the creativity and craftsmanship of Donato Montemitro, this model is everything you were waiting for.

programme.title: wallytender43x - High rate of innovation
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is in Venice on board the wallytender43X, a boat easy to navigate and perfect as a day-boat for a family, as a tender for a superyacht and more! Discover the innovations by Wally.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Discover Pearl 72, an incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Renier R11 - The essence of yachting
programme.desc: Discover a high-level boat, free from frills and excesses, with an automotive-inspired design. The maneuverability is excellent and the speed in changing course is fantastic. Get on board!

programme.title: Swan Shadow - Nautor Swan's first motorboat
programme.desc: Maurizio Bulleri is on board Swan Shadow, the first motorboat built by the world-famous shipyard Nautor Swan.

programme.title: Regal 38 SAV - Sport Activity Vessel
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Annapolis Boat Show to introduce you to the REGAL 38 SAV (Sport Activity Vessel). Discover all about this incredible motorboat

programme.title: Tiara 34 LS - Heaven on board
programme.desc: On board the new Tiara 34 LS, you can easily imagine yourself eating that fish that you just caught, enjoying life on board. This marvel offers you great habitability and an incredible sunbathing area, of which you can dispose easily. Heaven is right there, on board this marvel.

programme.title: An aggressive character
programme.desc: Do you have a sporting spirit? Then hop on this new Skipper BSK 34 NC. This version is the latest restyling of the NC 100S model, which in 2016 had won the Red Dot Award, a much sought-after international prize. On board, an important technical novelty… discover it with The Boat Show.

programme.title: Spectacular speeds
programme.desc: Come and discover the new SPX 38, built in Italy by SPX Ribs, a shipyard that got off to a good start and has consolidated its position over time. This max inflatable boat has been equipped with 2 Verado 450 and promises spectacular speeds.

programme.title: Prestige M48 - Fun and Comfort
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono presents the Prestige M48, Beneteaus new offering. This motor multihull is spacious and comfortable, a cozy home on the sea.

programme.title: Teen Fit Strength
programme.desc: Power up for everyday life with this top-notch resistance training.

programme.title: Baby Workout
programme.desc: Incorporate your child in your daily workout.

programme.title: Driving Fixes
programme.desc: Darrell Kestner helps fix your problems on the tee box

programme.title: Could This Be Love
programme.desc: Sandra, a small town country girl, returns home after college to take over the family business, her fathers beloved bed and breakfast. Facing an unfaithful husband and dysfunctional relationship with her mother, she finds herself at a difficult crossroads. Everything changes, however, when Terrance (Steven Sutton), a young, handsome lawyer checks in and opens her eyes to an entirely different life filled with happiness.

programme.title: Act Like You Love Me
programme.desc: Kelly Lofton is a young, successful dentist who has all the material things a woman could ask for. However, Kelly has struggled to find time for love in her busy schedule, so when her younger sister Susan gets engaged to a seemingly perfect man and organizes an extravagant engagement party, Kelly panics.

programme.title: Black Butterfly
programme.desc: Black Butterfly is about 16 year old Ariel- a girl with a dream. Making the Womens U.S. Swim Team will change her life. Ariel excitedly begins training when... tragedy strikes. She is brutally raped. Her dreams of swimming, relationships, and life are tossed to and fro as she struggles within the aftermath. Should she tell? Should she hide? Adrenaline and anticipation rise as her coach, family and friends find out about the rape in various ways. Now, what will each do to seek revenge? How will they deal with a rapist who is no stranger to their lives? What draws the line between pain and possibility for Ariel?

programme.title: Red is the Color of
programme.desc: A troubled relationship between a painter and his wife is put to the test when a nude model begins helping them explore another side of passion. "The performances are uniformly honest and multi-dimensional. This film will linger with you like the memory...

programme.title: Jumper on CA RT 99 with Eng 13
programme.desc: Firefighter Keola Park who youve see on Engine 3, is now part of the water rescue and USAR teams. He starts his day before his shift with a boot in his hand on a busy corner as part of the "Fill the Boot for Jerrys Kids" drive. 1st call, a gas leak, then off to water rescue training with the team at the pool. Then they all meet at the river with fast moving currents, for Keola, this is his first time. Afternoon shopping for the next 48 hours, and back to the station for a sit down lunch. Night, a call comes in, a man is standing on a giant road sign attached to the crossing bridge high above the California 99 Highway, and hes cutting his wrists, the road is closed in both ways and hes got an audience.

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 10
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: Eng 5 Residential Fire
programme.desc: Station 5, its the first morning of this 48 hour shift. They are all doing chores working on the yard. They had just finished up when the call came in; it sounds like a structure fire. As they are in route, it comes over the radio that neighbors are calling in, they see smoke. Engine 5 arrives on scene, the 1st In, and they pull a line, Mike is on the nozzle, and we go into the fire with Mike as he enters the garage, and its blazing. After the fire, they all re-hab, get their bottles filled while the Battalion Chief goes over the ops.

programme.title: Beyond the Green Veil
programme.desc: Beyond the Green Veil sets to explore the juxtaposition between backcountry recreation and the access the logging industry provides. Most outdoor enthusiasts are also environmentalists, caring deeply for the natural world and the locations. However, access to these spots is dictated by a necessary but destructive logging industry. Michael Darling, a professional surfer, explores this idea, linking up with professional backcountry skier, Chris Rubens, and snowboarder, Timmy Taussig. They understand each other’s worlds by means of an eight-day camping and touring trip in the Selkirk mountains and a surf trip to the west coast of Vancouver Island. Without shying away from the reality, what they learn challenges audiences and recreationists to contemplate their own role in shaping the future of our environment. Official Selection 2024: Brest Surf Film Festival.

programme.title: Keeping tradition alive in Dubai
programme.desc: Tradition isnt exactly what first comes to mind when one thinks of Dubai, a city that quite literally grew out of the desert, but tourists are flocking to the Middle Eastern oasis for a taste of its Bedouin past. Camel races Old meets new can be seen at Dubais Camel Racing Club where these ships of the desert sprint across the perimeter of the famed Al Mamoom racetrack. Attracting both camel owners and punters alike, spectators can sit in their cars and drive alongside the camels as they hurtle towards the finish line, guided by a remote control jockey. Organisers say the event is a draw for tourists for a number of reasons. “When tourists come to the camel racing venues, they see something new. They see how people treat the camels and how the camels compete with each other. They also see how Emirati society promotes camels, says the clubs CEO and General Amanager Ali Saeed Bin Saroud. Camel racing was promoted by the former UAE president, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan as a way of bringing camels and back into mainstream Dubai culture. The Dubai Royal Family also actively support camel racing as a way of preserving the traditional Bedouin culture. Desert culture The Al Marmoom Heritage Festival is Dubai’s annual celebration of the traditional Arabian desert culture and vital role which it plays in the cultural identity of its people. Traditional markets, music and dancing are another way in which the Bedouin culture is kept alive and enjoyed by Dubai locals and tourists alike. Arabic hospitality German expat Ursula Musch moved to Dubai around 20 years ago after first visiting in 1993. She now breeds camels and encourages tourists to experience the Bedouin customs for themselves, as they, like her, may just find their passion in life. My passion or my message is I want to give foreigners, other people the chance to know something from the Arabic hospitality, from their tradition, from their culture, to show it to give it to other people who don’t

programme.title: Wuzhen
programme.desc: Come visit Wuzhen, a 1,300-year-old water town on the lower reaches of the Yangtze River. Located on the Hangzhou-Jiaxing-Huzhou Plain in northern Zhejiang Province, it isat the center of the golden triangle consisting of Shanghai, Hangzhou and Suzhou. The most famous of the six “watertowns” in China, Wuzhen is commonly called “the Venice of the East” so taking a boat ride through the towns storied canals is a must. If you are going to make a day out of it, we recommend exploring the East section during the day and visiting the West section after 5p when the tourist crowds die down.

programme.title: The biodiversity of Dubai's shores has brought fly fishing to the Middle East for the first time
programme.desc: When most people think of fly fishing they think of being far out in the wilderness, away from civilisation, by a river or somewhere in the ocean. But Ocean Active Fly has re-imagined this scene - offering urban fly fishing right in the middle of Dubai. This is the first fly fishing operation in the Middle East. The founder, Nick Bowles, explained to Euronews why fishing there are fishing opportunities in Dubai: "Dubai’s built the biggest man-made reefs with the palm islands and that, so it’s created a huge habitat." Artificial reefs can lead to a quick increase in the local fish population. They draw plankton which smaller fish can prey on which then attracts bigger fish suitable for fly fishing. One species drawn to the artificial reefs in Dubai is the queenfish. They can grow to be over a metre long and up to 15 kilograms, although most are about half that weight. This kind of fish is particularly good for fly fishing because of its visual takes and the fact it swims in schools. Fly fishing differs from more conventional spin fishing. Instead of having a heavy lure at the end of the fishing line, fly fishers have a fly which is lighter and less likely to scare away game. The fly stays on the surface of the water where fish will be attracted to it, thinking it is prey. With ocean fly fishing youre constantly on the move to find the next school of fish "So you literally run - shoot, run - shoot." But the unique part of fly fishing in Dubai is the proximity to its skyline. Fly fishing is done close to the shore so anglers are surrounded by the citys landmarks.: the Burj Khalifa, the Burj Al Arab, Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina.

programme.title: "This is insane" Supercar Blondie's F1 crash course
programme.desc: Euronews Evan Bourke joins social media star, Supercar Blondie , to test drive an F1 racing car in Dubai. Shes become a social media sensation for testing out some of the worlds most beautiful cars, so what better way to meet Supercar Blondie , than to propose a test drive in the ultimate racing machine - an F1 race car. Euronews Dubai based correspondent Evan Bourke was given the breathtakingly gruesome job -honestly, his colleagues are not jealous - of having to take part in the test drive at the Dubai Autodome . The race track is one of the few places in the world where it is possible to get in an F1 car and experience the adrenaline rush that 6G and more than 500 horsepower has to offer. Supercarblondie has six million Instagram followers and is known for her love of Supercars but even this was a first for her. To watch the full episode of Adventures, click on the video link above.

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.desc: The sails are raised in Grenada on the 236-foot Mandalay. The ships 19 passengers arent sure exactly where this seven-day cruise will take us. The captain will only say this: "Youll be amazed." Islands photographer Jon Whittle captures what happens next.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Adventurous East London
programme.desc: Jewelry Designer Mira Ovaskainen tells us where to go and things to do in East London.

programme.title: Eating on a Budget in NYC's West Village
programme.desc: From Peking duck to divine sea salt chocolate chip cookies, Karavan CEO Ricky Berrin shares his affordable foodie finds in NYCs West Village.

programme.title: Overwater Bungalows at Sandals Grande St. Lucian, St. Lucia
programme.desc: We take you on a sneak peek tour of the new all-inclusive overwater bungalows at Sandals Grande St. Lucian, St. Lucia. The bungalows open to guests May 15, 2017.

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: San Miguel
programme.desc: As cultures clash and trends transcend borders, a lot of major destinations are starting to resemble one another - but not San Miguel de Allende. A small town nestled in central Mexico, San Miguel de Allende is anchored in its authenticity. A place where Mexican tradition guides, but doesn’t restrict, the new.The streets are an explosion of colorful colonial buildings, and its people are just as, if not more, vibrant. Home to countless artists and other creative types, San Miguel de Allende is alive with galleries, boutiques, restaurants and rooftop bars - which are perfect for the city’s “eternal spring” weather.At the end of the day, though, it’s a collective sense of pride and love for Mexican culture and history that makes San Miguel de Allende truly a world of its own; a place where ancient rituals live side by side with modern artisanal producers, like Casa Dragones tequila.It’s always in cities like this, where people know exactly who they are and where they come from, that we end up finding ourselves.

programme.title: Karaiya Spice House
programme.desc: For those that like to feel the burn, make a trip to Karaiya Spice House for some Hunan-style heat. Authentic Hunan dishes are beautifully presented at this award winning, lair of spice. A bouquet of Hunan chilis accompanies many of Karaiya’s menu items, but the restaurant does offer milder fare to tame the flames. Signature items include smoked ribs, steamed fish with chilis and flame-baked prawns wrapped in foil. Located on the 3rd floor of Sanlitun Village, Karaiya will also win you over with its elegant and understated design. Just remember that “normal” here is still very spicy.

programme.title: Broken Spanish
programme.desc: Theres a distinct image that might pop up in your head when you think of Mexican food. It may involve a puddle of beans next to over-sauced enchiladas. It may involve yellow cheese and crunchy shells. It may involve trucks and outdoor salsa bars. It most likely does not involve crispy skinned pork belly studded with pungent elephant garlic and elegantly strewn with radish sprouts and micro herbs. But maybe it should.Chef Ray Garcia—a born-and-bred Angeleno—is on the forefront of the modern Mexican food movement thats taking over the city, and Broken Spanish is his swanky flagship. The aforementioned CHICHARRON is one of the best large-format meat dishes in a 50-mile radius, while the LAMB NECK TAMAL is all gamey funk and pillowy tender masa. For dessert, the CAFE DE OLLA is a Mexican firing squad of chocolate, beer, and coffee to the face. The hyper-modern space—a mix of retro concrete breezeblocks, macrame, and greenery—is the perfect spot for that mezcal nightcap.

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: Dubai: Discover the jewels in the crown of the city's civilisation
programme.desc: When people think of Dubai it is often thought of as a new city. But, in fact, its history goes back more than 5,000 years. Archaeologists have unearthed a series of exciting and mysterious discoveries across the Emirate. These include the Jumeirah Archaeological site, which dates back to the Abbasid Period in the 10th century AD, to the Saruq Al Hadid site – a centre for human inhabitants and trade and metallurgy from the Umm Al Nar period (2600-2000 BCE) to the Iron Age. When the Jumeirah Archaeological site was discovered, experts noticed that the walls of the buildings there were plastered. Dr Mansour Boraik, an archaeology specialist from Dubai, said: "It was plastered inside and outside with white plaster. When they tried to picture the city during the Abbasid Period, and they imagined that it would look like a white city from the shores of the Gulf." The site shows Dubai during the Abbasid period which is around the 10th century AD. The geographical location of the site is important. It sits on the shoreline of Dubai but also on the major trade route between Mesopotamia, India and Oman. It also sits in-between the Arabic and Indian peninsular. The 80,000 square metre site sits in the shadow of the Burj Khalifa and the imposing Dubai skyline, emphasising the comparison between old and new worlds. The circular and semi-circular tower supports reflect the prosperity of the inhabitants of the time who will have been a mixture of locals and passing tradesmen. A variety of silver coins, pottery, copper, glass and stone artefacts have been excavated. Its one of the largest and most important Islamic sites ever discovered in the Gulf. It is also home to the oldest Mosque discovered in the UAE. Saruq al Hadid Saruq al Hadid is regarded as the jewel in the crown of archaeological discoveries In Dubai. This ancient industrial metallurgical centre dates back to the Iron Age and indicates that Dubai was a global trading hub. Ahmed Mahmoud, Director of Architectural Heritage Department in Dubai, said

programme.title: Find out why medical tourism is big business in Dubai
programme.desc: Medical tourism is a booming global industry, estimates on market size vary but the Patients Without Borders publishing group puts its value at around €60 to €80 billion worldwide, each year, with 20 to 24 million patients travelling for medical treatments annually. Around the world, aging populations, rising healthcare costs, and pressures on the insurance industry have created opportunities for destinations like Dubai , that have been able to invest rapidly in their healthcare infrastructure and capitalise on the sharp increase in demand for health tourism. Encouraging international institutions Dr Marwan Mohamed Al Mulla, CEO, Health Regulation Sector, Dubai Health Authority said, “Recently a new law has come into effect which encourages and allows international institutions to have their own, 100 percent ownership The Dubai Health Authority has had a medical tourism strategy in place since 2014 with the aim of developing and supporting its healthcare sector and steadily increasing its contribution towards Dubais gross domestic product. Focusing on an inbound patient’s airport-to-airport needs has helped providers capitalise too. Dr Basel Nasrallah, Medical Director, Armada said, “We in our facility, for example, get about 5 percent more patients from abroad. Patients are coming from all around the world. We are receiving patients from Russia, mainly Europe, Italy, Spain, UK, and North America from Africa, from South Asia Why have health checks in Dubai? Interestingly, many of those countries are known for the strength of their own medical tourism offerings, but Dubai is still an attractive option for patients who are looking to combine their treatments with other pursuits. Alexander Edwards, Surgical Patient, from the UK said, “Well there were multiple aspects I looked at prior to coming obviously looking at the time it takes, for the recovery period. I had all the research done before I came and found some fantastic reviews, very positive feedback from other friends and family that

programme.title: Sak Yant Tattoo
programme.desc: Traditional hand needle tattoos have been a staple of Thai culture for centuries with the common practitioners being Buddhist monks. Why? The spiritual significance and meanings behind the permanent body art are manifestations of the individual’s aura. Ajarn Noo, a former Buddhist monk turned spiritual Thai tattoo master, has gained international recognition since tattooing Angelina Jolie and consequently many other celebrities like Michele Rodriguez and David Beckham. His tattoo parlor is unlike any you’ve ever been to because he performs the spiritual practice in the sanctuary of his own home. Walk past the larger than life statues devoted to Buddha, up the stairs and into the top floor of his residence There you will find photos adorning his walls of countless celebrities, the royal family and others who have come before you. You can than evaluate your various options but here is the kicker – there is no guarantee you will get the tattoo you are looking for. You must first stand before Ajarn Noo for a spiritual evaluation and based on each individual’s aura, Ajarn Noo will either approve and customize a tattoo for you based on your own spirit or send you packing. So come with a clear heart, a clear mind and let your inner soul speak to Ajarn in hopes of a tattoo blessing that will be unlike any other.

programme.title: Duck de Chine
programme.desc: When you think Beijing, you think ancient history, bustling metropolis and duck. There arent many meals that can claim royal lineage dating back almost a thousand years to the ancient emperors of China. Known as Peking Duck, Beijing Duck or Chinese Roast Duck , this dish is a signature staple of the city and you could spend weeks soul searching and taste testing your way through a variety of recipes (yes, even KFC has one). To save you time, Duck de Chine is one of the annual contenders for the best roast duck in the land and offers an extravagant dining experience. An impressive and inviting décor, complete with vermillion fabrics, dazzling chandeliers, cozy brick walls and large round tables, offers a luxury setting to indulge in the local specialty. Whether you enjoy sugar or spice, a variety of delicious sides accompany the glistening moist meat of this whole duck, prepared over the open flames of 60 year old Jujube wood. Pro tip: dip the crispy skin directly in the raw sugar and enjoy the ride. Smaller dishes, a separate dim sum menu and a full champagne bar are also available so set aside plenty of time to plant yourself in this beautiful dining room and feast away like its 1330.

programme.title: Ventura County - A Relaxing Getaway

programme.title: Why day-trippers and holidaymakers are hooked on Dubai Marina
programme.desc: The glories of Dubai Marina Dubai Marina is much more than just a glamorous urban dock for luxury yachts (although its that as well!) Its also home to a huge range of chic bars and restaurants to suit all tastes and moods. And, of course, it has those iconic towers that define its famous skyline. One of the best ways to admire the architecture around Dubai Marina is from the deck of a boat. You can charter a private yacht, hop onboard an organised boat tour - or you can even cross the marina for as little as €2 in a water taxi. Five-star resorts hug the coastline. Their vast, marble-clad lobbies lead to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunch venues and postcard-perfect beaches. As for Dubai Marinas beach clubs, from Drift to Zero Gravity , they are dizzyingly beautiful; their pool decks are catwalks for the latest swimwear fashions. Jumereirah Beach Residence Jumeirah Beach Residence itself is the largest single-phase commercial and residential project in the world. Its strategically lined along a chic waterfront strip known as The Walk , feautring stunning 3D murals. The Walk has a very varied range of fashion, home and handicraft shops and boutiques. The outdoor pop-up market stalls offer jewellery, food treats and homeware, as well as performances by street entertainers. Jumereirah Beach Residence is made up of 40 high-rise buildings divided into six clusters, all with superb access to first-class retailers, entertainment venues and restaurants. Up on the Flying Cup The adjacent cosmopolitan shopping area The Beach has many attractions, including the floating adventure park Aqua Fun . This amazing water park makes a statement, by spelling out "I ♡ Dubai" via is pools and slides when seen from above. Another highlight at The Beach is The Flying Cup , a ride that you can sit in and be elevated to fabulous views, seen in all their glory from 40 metres up - while eating and drinking! From the top, you can see Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah and, of course, that wonderful Duba

programme.title: Outdoor Activities in South London
programme.desc: Looking for fun things to do in South London? Travel Savvy asked Look Mum No Hands owner Lewin Chalkley about the best outdoor activities south of the Thames River.

programme.title: Dubai Creek: Discover a lost Arabian world
programme.desc: Dubai Creek flows through the Emirates historic heart. For just one dirham, abra rides provide boatloads of nostalgia while travelling between the souks and museums of Deira and Bur Dubai. These heritage hubs recall the Bedouins’ humble and ancient past built on pearls, and then shaped by a free trade boom that brought new settlers to the creek in the early 1900’s. Echoing that era, today’s expats – some descendants of those early traders – share authentic flavours from their homelands in a culinary kaleidoscope that compliments Emirati fare. Popular food tours Food tours are a popular way to explore Dubai Creek. Arva Ahmed is the founder of Frying Pan Adventures. She describes one of the restaurants that features on the tours itinerary. "One of the restaurants we stop on our tour is called Sultan Dubai Falafel," she says. "And the thing that they are known for is stuffed falafels. They stuff them with chilli, onion and sumac. These falafels are the most juiciest most filled with herbs and fragrant falafels that you’re going to find in the city." Deira’s Waterfront market is piled high with technicolour fruit and vegetables and stacks of shellfish with legs choreographed in chorus-line unison. Here you can buy the catch of the day and have it cooked in many different ways for old-school Creekside dining. Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary Until recently, the creek ended at Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary. Here nature lovers can spot flamingos that migrate to the Sanctuary, a wetland extension of the creek spread over 6.2 sq.km. It features a variety of mangroves and lagoons perfect for migrating birds - the sanctuary is home to over 180 species of birds. Following its expansion as Dubai Canal, the creek curves past book-shaped Mohammed Bin Rashid Library, high-rise Business Bay and beach-hugging Jumeirah before it’s reunited with its source - the glittering Arabian Gulf.

programme.title: Flying on water - James O'Hagan tries out the latest addition to the surfing family
programme.desc: It looks like a surfboard, it moves like a surfboard, but its not a surfboard. Its an electric hydrofoil or E-foil. I visited Dubai Marine to have a go at E-foiling myself and find out what makes the activity so thrilling. The man putting me through my paces was Daniel van Dooren, the manager of Ibiza Foils and co-founder of Surf House Dubai . "The thing that makes it different is this hydrofoil wing on the bottom," explained Daniel. "Its got an aeroplane design, which basically lifts you out of the water and gives you that sensation like you’re flying." The E-foils are powered by an electric propeller and controlled remotely via Bluetooth. They can reach speeds of up to 45km an hour. Find out how I got on with my first experience on an E-foil by watching the video above this article. Heres a clue: I wont be giving up my day job anytime soon.

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Theres the LA you see in the movies, and then theres the real LA—a gritty, fantastically diverse collection of neighborhoods sprawled between ocean and mountains, each with its own distinct mood. Los Angeles spent years striving to emulate towns like New York or San Francisco, but over the last decade the city took a long hard look in the mirror, dug what it saw, and started focusing on what it does best: casual, multicultural, and effortlessly cool.The new LA is the place everyone suddenly wants to be, where high and low converge on palm-lined sidewalks. The countrys most thriving food scene is here, run by a guerilla band of ethnically diverse chefs cooking up whatever they want, wherever they want, with the best produce in the world. From the industrial warehouses east of downtown to the beachside shopping meccas of Venice, LAs cutting edge street style, art scene, and culinary chops cant be contained—the creative energy pops through the concrete like ficus roots. And just to sweeten the deal, 280-plus days of breezy sunshine form the backdrop of it all. Just dont forget your shades.

programme.title: Visit Curacao: Explore the Culture, Music and Adventure
programme.desc: Curacao, or Korso in the native Papiamento, is the most authentic, populous and cosmopolitan of the ABC islands the Dutch Antilles. It is a cultural enthusiast’s dream and a language lover’s paradise.

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Chiloe: Exploring Chile's Largest Island & Warmest Secret

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

In an exclusive interview with Black Enterprise CEO Butch Graves, this business powerhouse discusses, among other topics, his “Affirmative Development” principles to advance business opportunities for African Americans.

programme.title: The Best of Luxe Life
programme.desc: This week on “Women of Power,” we highlight the best of our most popular Luxe Life segments. We start our with a trip through the streets of New York City on a “Sex and the City” bus tour, showing off the glamorous spots featured on the popular television show. Then, our Luxe Life Correspondent Dariany Santana introduces us to Cheryl B. Walker-Robertson, who shows us why good manners make for good business. From there, Dariany takes us backstage at the Women of Power Summit for the Macy’s Fashion show with fashion expert Audrey Smaltz. And from spring fashion to winter wear, we stay warm in style with Irene Gandy, who shows off her Fur Fashion collection. And whether you have a need for speed or just want a head-turning new ride, Dariany Santana highlights some of the 2015 luxury cars hitting dealerships. And as the holiday season approaches, Makini Brereton offers a few tips on decorating your home for the holidays. And finally, after the festivities are over, Dariany helps with a proactive workout to get you fit and ready for the new year with Nicole Chaplin of Bella X Fitness.

programme.title: Building a Business With Your Spouse
programme.desc: Monique Wilsondebriano and her husband have turned a backyard grilling hobby into big business with Charleston Gourmet Burger Co.

programme.title: Inside the 2015 International Auto Shows
programme.desc: We highlight the two largest Auto Shows of 2015 from both the North American International Auto Show and the New York International Auto Show. Ludwig Willisch, CEO of BMW of North America, highlights why BMWs latest model is what todays driver is looking for. Then, we profile Perry Watson III, CEO of Lexus of Mishawaka, who takes on a new role this year as the Chairman of NAMAD, the National Association of Minority Automobile Dealers. Then we chat with Ed Welburn, the Vice President of Global Design at General Motors. He lets us sit in the latest Concept Car to roll off the assembly line. And finally, we take a walk with Damon Lester, president of NAMAD, who gives us an update on the state of minority automobile dealers around the country.

programme.title: Devil's Triangle: Portal or Peril?
programme.desc: What are the dancing lights and flames in the sky documented by Christopher Columbus in the ocean area called the Devil’s Triangle? Where does the green fog come from? What has caused the disappearance of ships and planes? What is fantasy? What is fact?

programme.title: World Mysteries - Pearl Harbor: Surprise Attack or Anticipated Event?
programme.desc: December 7, 1941: The Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, Hawaii devastates the U.S. Pacific Fleet and pushes America into World War II. . The history books fail to explain if the ‘surprise’ attack was really a surprise. This program addresses that question.

programme.title: Horror Box!
programme.desc: For the insatiable Horror Freak, there is no other box to behold, not even the dybbuk box has the power of The Horror Box! The handle cranks, the box opens, you hear the shrill cackle of the Horror Box Gremlin unleashing its evil upon the universe, sick sadistic images roll before your eyes, and when your guard is down the Horror Box captures your soul for all eternity.

programme.title: The Conspiracy to Rule the World: From 911 to the Illuminati
programme.desc: The individuals in this film all share a common bond - they were awakened. They awoke to a world that was unfamiliar to them and one that was often terrifying and bizarre. Suddenly those trusted men and women in power became manipulators and power hungry dictators and not the democratic leaders we are led to believe. A unique collection of evidence and theory is set out in this film to reveal a new world order. 9/11, the Twin Towers and Pentagon deceptions. The sinister group known as Common Purpose. The Moon Landings - were they faked? Do these disparate elements share a common goal to rule the world? You decide. Plus special features. A film in partnership with Edge Media TV in the UK and Reality Films.

programme.title: UK Haunters

programme.title: Autumn River
programme.desc: Enjoy soaring over the brilliant autumn colors of the Truckee River in the Sierra Nevada Mountains of California. The exhilarating visuals are accompanied by a relaxing soundtrack in this 60 minute ambient nature film.

programme.title: Preview for Arches & Canyonlands Ambient Nature Film
programme.desc: The sublime landscape of Arches and Canyonlands area of Utah is the star in this 90 minute film, which showcases awe-inspiring natural arches, dramatic canyon vista sunrises & sunsets, and flights through arches and over the Colorado River canyon. The spectacular cinematography is accompanied by beautiful Native American flute music. Note: All Drone footage was filmed outside of National and State Park boundaries. Runtime 90 minutes. Available now to subscribers via www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview of Journey Through the Lofoten Islands
programme.desc: Visit the spectacular Lofoten Islands of northern Norway in this relaxing nature film. Soar above the mystical peaks that plunge into the ocean, and enjoy the quaint villages that dot the remote shorelines of the fjords. The full film is 90 minutes in length and available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview For "Yosemite Waterfalls & Wildflowers" 2 Hour Relaxing Nature Film
programme.desc: Available to stream on May 29, 2021. In the Spring Yosemites spectacular waterfalls combine with an exquisite display of Dogwood blossoms to create an awe inspiring experience like no other. Immerse yourself in the wonders of Yosemite in this 2 hour relaxing nature film "Yosemite, Waterfalls & Wildflowers". The spectacular cinematography is accompanied by a beautiful acoustic guitar soundtrack. Available at www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview of Matted Art Displays
programme.desc: This is a preview of a series of 15 of Elizabeth Carmels Fine Art Photographs matted like framed art pieces.The full 2 1/2 hour film displays each photograph for 10 minutes. To remain on one photograph press pause, follow the directions in our video "Displaying Fine Art Photographs on Your Apple TV and Roku.

programme.title: Preview of Winter Wonder, Sierra Mountains
programme.desc: This is a preview of "Winter Wonder, Sierra Mountains, available to stream at www.NatureStream.tv. Experience the exhilarating snows of winter in the spectacular Sierra Nevada Mountains.Naturestream.tv Ambient Nature Films will transform your screen into a spectacular display of natural beauty that inspires the spirit and soothes the soul.

programme.title: Preview for Journey Through Alaska
programme.desc: Experience the magnificence of the Alaskan wilderness in "Journey Through Alaska". Fly over blue glaciers, see grizzly cubs cuddle with their mom, and witness alpenglow on Denali in this new release from NatureStream.tv. The full 90 minute film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv on August 22, 2023.

programme.title: Big Sur
programme.desc: Journey through Big Sur, a renowned stretch of the California Coast featuring amazing cliffs & sea stacks, beaches, wildflowers, redwood forests, sealife, and brilliant ocean waters. Spectacular cinematography is accompanied by a soothing soundtrack of music and ocean waves. Runtime 90 minutes.

programme.title: Preview for "Alaska" Art Display Film
programme.desc: This is a preview for the 1 hour long Art Display Film "Alaska". Journey into the beautiful wilderness of Alaska through the photography of Olof & Elizabeth Carmel. This art display film showcases their most stunning photographs of Americas last great wilderness - from breaching whales and misty mountains of the Inside Passage to the Grizzlies and soaring peaks of Denali National Park. This 60 minute film will give you new appreciation for the wilderness of the wild North. Accompanied by a beautiful acoustic guitar soundtrack. To see the full film please subscribe to NatureStream.tv Streaming Channel, with free apps for all streaming devices, at www.NatureStream.tv

programme.title: Preview of Ambient Nature Films
programme.desc: NatureStream.TV provides instant access to scenic nature relaxation videos & art from amazing locations around the world. Stay in and explore with our diverse collection of ambient nature films paired with beautiful soundtracks. Transform your TV & mobile screens into an art display with a stunning collection of on demand fine art landscape photographs by Elizabeth and Olof Carmel. NatureStream.TV turns your TV or mobile screens into a curated display of "ambient art" that inspires the spirit and soothes the soul. In addition, experience the exhilaration of biking, hiking, and skiing along some of the most beautiful trails in the world with NatureStream.TV’s collection of on demand trail videos. Enjoy our videos anytime for inspiration, relaxation, rejuvenation, or rehabilitation. Learn more at www.NatureStream.tv

programme.title: The Napa Valley - A Journey through America's Wine Country
programme.desc: The Napa Valley" features the spectacular landscape photography of Olof & Elizabeth Carmel paired with beautiful piano and guitar instrumentals. This 42 minute video is a relaxing and inspiring journey into the beauty of Americas Wine Country - The Napa Valley. It features the seasons of the Napa Valley, from spring wildflowers and blossoms through the rich colors of autumn in the vineyards.

programme.title: The Rise Of Fredia Gibbs
programme.desc: S1:E6 Fredia Gibbs was the first female African American kickboxing world champion who learned how to fight as a child because she grew up scared and afraid. It wasn’t until she unknowingly got into a van alone after a party with a man who turned out to be a serial killer, that all the years of fighting and training would help her unleash the power she had inside of her and catapult her to new heights.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: Gwen Stefani vs. Gavin Rossdale
programme.desc: S1:E3 When Gwen Stefani’s happy 20-year relationship with Gavin Rossdale came crashing down, and she started dating Blake Shelton right after the divorce, the media went crazy. Discover the real story of the months of media torture Gwen had to go through, and where she is now in her new relationship with her new man.

programme.title: The Kardashians vs. Jordyn Woods
programme.desc: S1:E4 Jordyn Woods was somebody the Kardashian family trusted. But all that changed when rumours of her being a home wrecker emerged after a scandalous yet confusing night at a party with Khloé Kardashian’s then-boyfriend and NBA player, Tristan Thompson. Our team investigated both sides of the story and got the real truth about what happened that night.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: Kristen Stewart vs. Robert Pattinson
programme.desc: S1:E2 Every girl wanted to be Bella Swan in the blockbuster movie, Twilight. When Kristen Stewart auditioned and got the role, she fell in love with co-star Robert Pattinson shortly after, and the world became obsessed with the new young couple. But what Kristen didn’t expect was the endless media scrutiny, paparazzi following her entire life, and the endless craze from fans. After getting caught in a shocking scandal and being villainized by the entire world. But the media got her story wrongKristen had to embrace her authenticity to have the courage to be who she truly was regardless of what the world thought. We dug into Kristen and Roberts romance to find the real life story behind the tabloids.

programme.title: Justin Bieber Vs. Hailey Bieber
programme.desc: S2:E7 Justin and Hailey Bieber are at the height of their careers. So why do they keep getting sick? Our team uncovers this isn’t the first time one of Justin’s love interests has had a life-threatening illness. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Selena Gomez with Hailey?

programme.title: Chris Gardner: CEO of Happyness
programme.desc: Goalcast EXCLUSIVE! ﻿﻿Remember the movie "The Pursuit of Happyness" starring Will Smith? Some may not know that Chris Gardner is the REAL person behind Will Smiths character.﻿﻿ But until now, a BIG part of his story was never told. In this Goalcast Original, Chris finally opens up to the world about WHAT HAPPENED to him after losing the love of his life.

programme.title: Scott Smiley: Fighting for Life - A Soldier's Comeback
programme.desc: US Army Officer Scott Smiley was on a mission to protect his country when he accidentally became the victim of a shocking suicide bombing. What he does next is nothing short of a miracle.

programme.title: Surviving A Death March
programme.desc: Forced to march over 350 miles, Gerda Weissmann Klein was moments away from sub-zero death when she survived the impossible. How did Gerda fight to survive when fewer than 120 people came out alive? And what simple gesture restored her faith in humanity?

programme.title: Chadwick Boseman: Live Your Purpose
programme.desc: Chadwick Boseman lived a life of humility and service on and off screen. He didnt let his diagnosis stop him from showing up for those around him and using his platform to elevate black voices. A true hero, he made every day count.

programme.title: Rise Above Shame
programme.desc: Iyanla Vanzants husband mistreated her for years -- threatening their children and trapping her with fear of greater violence. She shares how she found the strength to leave and escape the cycle.

programme.title: Jonny Kim: Launched into Adulthood
programme.desc: Jonny Kim changed careers three times before he even turned 40! Who would believe that this highly decorated Navy SEAL, doctor, and NASA astronaut would be hiding a tragic secret about his past? In the end, what his colleagues have to say about him will bring you to tears.

programme.title: Kailash Satyarthi: Man vs. Mafia
programme.desc: Nobel Peace Prize Winner Kailash Satyarthi has dedicated his life to ending child trafficking in India. Hes freed over 87,000 children from horrific slave-like conditions, but he couldnt save the one person who mattered most...Why does he continue to risk his life to end child labor?

programme.title: Mia Kang: The Woman That I Am
programme.desc: Overweight as a child, Mia Kang suffered bullying and a far from ideal childhood. Desperate to lose weight and feel good about herself, Mia began starving herself at the young age of 13. She lost a lot of weight very quickly and this launched her into the modeling industry which continued to destroy her self-esteem and health, until a vacation in Thailand, and her discovery of Muay Thai changed her life forever.

programme.title: Linda Cliatt-Wayman: A Teacher Like No Other
programme.desc: Linda Cliatt-Wayman volunteered to be Principal of one of the most dangerous schools in America. On her first day, she quickly realized that the job was much more complex and frightening than she thought. But, she was determined to give her students hope, even when they were threatening her life.

programme.title: Bre Lasley: Uninvited Guest
programme.desc: Bre & Kayli Lasley called 911 four times as they fought for their lives against an ex-con who broke into their home, but the police never arrived. How did Bre survive this terrifying home invasion? And what happened to her younger sister, Kayli?

programme.title: A Christmas Choice
programme.desc: ‘‘In business, what you don’t get done today can be done tomorrow. But with family, what doesn’t get done today is gone forever.‘’ - Rory Vaden

programme.title: Tell my Story
programme.desc: Jason Reid faced every parent’s worst nightmare when his son Ryan died by suicide at the age of 14. The tragedy lit a fire in him to end teen suicide by 2030. Fathers NEED To Change NOW. In this Goalcast Original, Jason Reid and a group of fathers have an intense conversation about teen suicide. Jason shares his heartfelt story as well as crucial parenting advice that can have life-saving consequences. Witness the power of vulnerability and discover simple ways you can transform your relationship with your kids by giving them the tools to thrive in life.

programme.title: How To WORK AND Receive Social Security At The SAME Time?!
programme.desc: Are you wondering how to make the most of your retirement income and your Social Security benefits? In todays video by Marvin Musick from Medicare School, youll gain invaluable knowledge into a topic that could shape your financial future. Marvin takes a Deep Dive into all of the ins and outs of working while receiving Social Security benefits, revealing the secrets behind calculating your monthly payout. Discover how your top 35 years of earnings, adjusted for inflation, influence your benefit amount and learn why your Full Retirement Age (FRA) is a pivotal factor in this equation. But, wait, theres more! Hell also walk you through the Earnings Test, an essential concept for anyone considering early retirement. Learn about the income thresholds and reduction rates that may affect your Social Security benefits, ensuring youre well-prepared to make these important decisions about your financial well-being and future!

Totally lost, she is discovered by Alfred, a Gwich'in hunter who reluctantly takes her under his wing as he navigates the massive landscape in search of caribou. When Alfred is severely wounded in a bear attack Lia pushes on and fights to save both of their lives.

Se trata de un programa mensual de 30 minutos de duración que comenzó a emitirse en agosto de 2016. Está compuesto de tres segmentos que destacan por su diversidad temática.
